metadata.title: CVE-2024-6345 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability in the package_index module of pypa/setuptools versions upto 69.1.1 allows for remote code execution via its download functions.These functions, which are used to download packages from URLs provided byusers or retrieved from package index servers, are susceptible to codeinjection. If these functions are exposed to user-controlled inputs, suchas package URLs, they can execute arbitrary commands on the system. Theissue is fixed in version 70.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-6345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pip - 24.2+dfsg-1
python3-pip-whl - 24.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

python3-pkg-resources - 74.1.2-1
python3-setuptools - 74.1.2-1
python3-setuptools-whl - 74.1.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-pip package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '24.2+dfsg-1').
setuptools package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '74.1.2-1').
